fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26898].
  {panel}

When assigning an issue the notification is sent, however when bulk assigning issues the notifications are not.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Set your Notification Scheme to send an email to the current assignee when an issue is assigned. (_as shown in the screenshot "NotificationScheme"_)
# Assign an issue to the user e.g. *User1*.
#* The user will receive a notification. (_See attached screenshot "SingleAssignment"_)
# Bulk assign several issues to e.g. *User2* (_I tested assigning 3 at once_)
#* The user will not receive any notifications.

(The names was just for example, you can assign all to the same users and he will only receive notifications when an issue is assigned without using bulk edit)
fields.summary: The notifications are not sent when bulk assigning issues
Provide default values for issue fields
Global Image repository

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26888].
  {panel}

In regards to [GHS-3904] and [GHS-3904|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3904] it has been discovered that up until recently customers have been asked to set up their Oracle databases with missing privelages to create sequences and and triggers. 

The documentation has since taken amendments [JRA-26840],[JRA-26879].

As an improvement/bug can it be made that upon install/upgrade of JIRA 5.0 onwards that JIRA can check the oracle database to see that it has the correct privelages? This should catch the bad configurations where they start. 

AO requires these privelages when creating tables etc... in the database and will fail if these are set otherwise.
fields.summary: Jira 5 to stop upgrade/install if Oracle database permissions are incorrect.
Transition end-point can be "Self" as well as a specific state

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26884].
  {panel}

It's a common issue in support: 
Customers will create Custom Field, associate it to the right schemes but complain they can't add the Custom Field to a screen.

It's always due to the Context.

Maybe, we should put a reminder so customers could check it.
fields.summary: Configuring a Screen could suggest users to review Custom Field context

fields.description:
We are currently using JIRA to track and manage defects raised by multiple teams. Each team has a JIRA project - and users are generally permitted to raise issues within their own projects. Issues can be moved between projects to reflect whoever currently has responsibility for each particular issue.

When an issue is moved between projects the reporter changes (for some reason). It is important for us that the reporter remains the same irrespective of which project the issue resides within.

I would appreciate any help or explanation that anyone can provide of why this is happening - and how to stop it happening. As I cannot seem to determine the problem / solution by myself.
fields.summary: The reporter keeps changing when I move issues between projects
Allow runtime configuration of new loggers

In Project Administration's People section, it is easy to distinguish user by referring their email address and username when they insert user's full name:

!first-user.jpg|thumbsnail!
!second-user.png|thumbsnail!

But when there are a lot of name-collisions in user directory, it is not easy for admin to check the following Full Name is belongs to whom.

!screenshot.220.jpg|thumbsnail!

*Suggestion*: It will be great if admin have the option to show extra user information or custom properties (such as department, team and etc) besides the Full Name display. 

Same goes to Issue's Person section:

!screenshot.221.jpg|thumbsnail!

The hover action on user name will display their information is good enough, somehow, we can improve this section as well as above suggestion.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26868].
  {panel}

This exists in 4.4.4 and 5.x, so I expect it's been the case for all time.  To reproduce:
1. Create a user with a special character in both the username and the password.  "josé" is a convenient example (You can probably enter it using option-e followed by another e on a Mac or holding down Alt while typing 0233 on the numeric keypad on Windows.)
2. Verify that the new user can log in using the same browser on the same platform.
3. Attempt to log in using a different browser on a different platform.  Frequently, this does not work.

The problem seems to be that the password field's character set depends on the platform and browser settings.  On my Mac, I found that Chrome and Safari on the Mac were generally compatible with one another, but neither would interoperate with Firefox on the Mac or with IE8/9 running on a Windows system.

I think what's happening here is that (at least as far as I can see) the input form does not specify the accept-charset HTML attribute, leaving the choice up to the browser.  Form submission is not necessarily constrained to use the same charset as the HTML that created the form.

My understanding is that you can use accept-charset="UTF-8" in the form element to force most browsers to use that encoding for their data.  IE apparently ignores this but can be convinced to behave itself by including a (hidden) input with a value like U+2620 (SKULL AND CROSSBONES), to force it to use UTF-8 form the whole form.

Note that usernames are not affected; this only seems to impact the password.  Naturally, none of this matters if you can convince users that they should stick with ASCII-only passwords.
fields.summary: I18N encoding of user passwords is not consistent across browsers/platforms

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26867].
  {panel}

1) Configure a connection to Zendesk. 
2) From the View Issue page, attempt to create a link to a ZenDesk ticket.

The dialog shows no errors, and when you click "Link" it closes but doesn't create the link. There is no indication in the UI about what has gone wrong.

http://screencast.com/t/ZWFPCV3BEUf

* A connection test completes successfully.
* There are no records of anything in the diagnostics except the successful connection tests.
* I've set up authentication to the jira-agent@customware.net user using the API token shown on the Zendesk pages.
* The only possibly relevant info in the JIRA logs is this:
{noformat}
@400000004f18b8ca02d5076c 2012-01-20 11:43:44,047 TP-Processor2 WARN admin 703x3019x1 sgozdw 59.167.133.3,59.167.133.69 
/plugins/servlet/customware/connector/config.action [apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector] 
Required proxy credentials not available for BASIC <any realm>@squid:3128
@400000004f18b8ca0330660c 2012-01-20 11:43:44,053 TP-Processor2 WARN admin 703x3019x1 sgozdw 59.167.133.3,59.167.133.69 
/plugins/servlet/customware/connector/config.action [apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector] 
Preemptive authentication requested but no default proxy credentials available
{noformat}
I remember we've encountered that message before with the Connectors but I think it was a false alarm.

To be clear, there are three issues here:
1) (As a tester) I can't get it working and I don't know why, so I can't complete the testing.
2) (As an end-user) I have no error feedback to let me know I need to get an admin to look at it.
3) (As an admin) I have no information to help me identify and fix the issue.

Please feel free to log in to https://jirra.jira-dev.com (Log in as a Studio user, admin/admin ) to investigate.
fields.summary: Customware Connectors - cannot create a Zendesk link and no error feedback is provided
Administrators in JIRA Cloud should be able to access General configuration > Advanced configuration

Hi,

When we create issues or during the transitions we often use the version/s fields (affects version/s, fix version/s and we have added a verify version/s).
For those fields we use the autocomplete renderer. 

It would be nice to display the version description when we open the list of version while creating an issue (or during the transitions).

For the moment, when we don't have in mind the content of the future release, we have to open the Versions panel of the project to check.

Regards,
François

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26849].
  {panel}

Basically, I'd like to be able to create a field for which one attribute of the field definition itself would be a template of a URL which would be executed in a new window by appending (or otherwise including) the contents of the field.

In other systems, such as RT, this type of feature is shown by a link icon next to the field (so that you can still edit the field in edit mode). If you click the link icon, it opens the URL in a new window.

The minimum requirement would be to be able to append the contents of the field to a URL. For example, if we were referencing a JIRA URL, we'd use:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/
as the base URL (defined with the field), and then the field contents would be JST-30260 (for this ticket), which would result in:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-30260
when clicked.

Optionally, a more flexible scheme would allow the substitution of the field for a character or sequence of characters in the URL in the field definition, but that's unnecessary for our applications.
fields.summary: Create a Custom Field type that is populated based on the value of something else
Allowing ordering by project category in filter/issue navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26822].
  {panel}

1) Find/create an instance of OnDemand where the Customware Connectors have not yet been configured.
2) Go to an issue and bring up the Link dialog.
3) Click on the "Connector Link" tab on the left.

The connector attempts to show its licensing screen inline in the dialog, which a) doesn't fit, b) doesn't work, and c) prevents the dialog from being used or dismissed.

!CustomwareLicence.png!

Given that these plugins are installed and enabled by default on OnDemand, and the vast majority of customers are not using them, the "Connector Link" option should not be shown in the Link dialogue unless the admin has explicitly configured Connector links to remote systems.
fields.summary: Customware Connectors breaks the Link dialog when not yet configured

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26816].
  {panel}

I enjoy a lot the new possibilities coming in JQL for doing requests on history, mainly driven through new keyword CHANGED and its operators (TO, FROM, BY, BETWEEN, etc).

However, for benefiting to its full potential from these new possibilities, it's important to retrieve in query result columns related to the query done on history.

For instance, one can now ask what were the issues planned for a version during last week. But if we want to sort the result by name of the people who did the planification, we can't, because we have no column available with the name of the people who did the change.

Another example, one can now ask what were the issues planned by 'Smith' during last week. But if we want to sort the result by value of new FixVersion, or by value of old FixVersion, we can't, because we have no column available with the value of the field changed during the change (old value and new value).

Either I'm missing something, or these new, computed, columns are missing for exploiting queries on history to their full power.
fields.summary: It's great having CHANGED keyword in JQL. Next step is having columns 'changer/old value/new value' available in filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26815].
  {panel}

If you invoke IssueService.validateTransition() and IssueService.transition() inside of a post-function or an event listener (which is triggered by a post-function):

* the history log is correct
* the activity log is correct
* the available transitions on the issue screen are correct
* BUT the status of the issue is NOT correct

So the issue is left in a confusing state where the status tells the user one thing, but the available transitions to perform tell the user something else.

For additional details, please see the internal support issue https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-105568, where Atlassian has confirmed that "Indeed it is not possible to fire off a transition to a new status from within a post function using the issueService".
fields.summary: IssueService.validateTransition() and transition() are unusable inside of post-functions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26806].
  {panel}

In the usual GUI, if an issue is moved between project, JIRA is capable of redirecting the user from the old URL to the new one with a HTTP code 302. 

This feature would be extremely useful in the REST API as well if we're trying to get an issue using only the issue KEY (no search). 

Use case:
 - a user create an issue AAA-123
 - Java app (API) using a search extract that issue to disk (or perform some work on the issue) and store the issue key (AAA-123) on disk.
 - User move issue from project AAA to project BBB, resulting in BBB-234
 - the REST API querying issue AAA-123 no longer find the issue (HTTP code 404 in REST)...

Expected result:
 - the REST API allows the request to succeed, giving you BBB-234. The key field in the JSON will be BBB-234.
 - -the REST API should return a code 302 with the self URL of the moved issue to the new location.- (JIRA will not 302 in this case)


BTW, I was hoping to workaround the problem with a JQL query like:
{noformat}
"issuekey" was "AAA-123"
{noformat}

but the "was" keyword doesn't seem to be present in JIRA 4.4.3.

That issue is also present in the SOAP API, although I'm sure fixing only REST would be sufficient as we're all moving that API anyway ;)
fields.summary: Allow REST callers to access moved issue via their old issue KEY

The introductory line of the *SMTP Mail Server* page (on the *Outgoing Mail* tab of the JIRA admin area), says:
* The table below shows the SMTP mail server currently configured for JIRA.

Extend this slightly to:
* The table below shows the SMTP mail server currently configured for JIRA. This is the mail server that JIRA uses to send notifications about various events.

----

Likewise, the introductory line of the *POP / IMAP Mail Servers* page (on the *Incoming Mail* tab of the JIRA admin area), says:
* The table below shows the POP / IMAP mail servers currently configured for JIRA.

Extend this slightly to:
* The table below shows the POP / IMAP mail servers currently configured for JIRA. Email messages sent to these mail servers used by JIRA to create issue comments and new issues.

It would be useful to have Priority Schemes to allow setting different levels of priorities per project or issue type.

 

*Workaround*

fields.summary: Create Admin screen for Priority Scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26775].
  {panel}

The LocalGadgetSpecFactory hangs onto a cache of CacheableGadgetSpec objects, which is updated when a plugin's modified date is after the date at which we put it into the cache.

As these objects are loaded via the plugin's class loader (as far as we are aware), this will block the destruction of the plugin's class loader on plugin uninstall.

This may potentially lead to ClassCastExceptions in the future.

One could first verify that this is an issue by using YourKit to take a memory dump after uninstalling a plugin, and determining if the plugin's class loader is still in memory.
fields.summary: LocalGadgetSpecFactory may potentially block destruction of gadget plugin class loader

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26773].
  {panel}

There are two wording improvements that constitute this issue:
# When creating a remote link to an issue on another JIRA server, if you don't have permission to access the issue on the remote JIRA server, the following message is displayed:
\\ \\
#* {{Failed to create reciprocal link from XYZ-123. The remote JIRA instance returned the following error: No Link Issue Permission for issue 'XYZ-123'.}}
\\ \\
However, this feels a little cumbersome and is potentially cryptic. Hence, could we please change this to:
\\ \\
#* {{-A reciprocal link from issue 'XYZ-123' back to this issue was not created as you do not have the 'Link Issue' project permission for 'XYZ-123' on the remote JIRA server.-}} This text was not possible as the error message is given by the remote JIRA server.
\\ \\
#* {{A reciprocal link from issue 'XYZ-123' back to this issue was not created as the remote JIRA server returned the following error: No Link Issue Permission for issue 'XYZ-123'.}}
\\ \\
# When creating a remote link to a Confluence page, if the Confluence site's remote API feature has not been enabled (which is highly likely considering that this feature is disabled by default in Confluence), the following message is displayed:
\\ \\
#* {{Could not access Confluence Remote API. Please check that it is enabled.}}
\\ \\
However, this message's brevity makes it fairly cryptic and it doesn't really explain the cause of the problem --- which the user would find frustrating. Hence, could we change this to:
\\ \\
#* {{Content on the Confluence site could not be accessed because the Confluence server's 'Remote API' feature is disabled. The Confluence system administrator must enable this 'Remote API' feature for JIRA to successfully access this content.}}
fields.summary: Wording improvements for Remote Issue Link-related error messages in JIRA 5.0.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26756].
  {panel}

Login into JIRA OnDemand instance.

1. From the JIRA's Projects menu on top left corner, choose a Project.
2. Click on Tempo (from Top Nav Bar), choose Project
3. On the page '/secure/TempoProjectBoard!timesheet.jspa', choose the same Project that was chosen in Step 1.
Actually, it results in a JS Error alert !proj_js_error.png!

Cancel the alert and pick the Project and click on the refresh icon !refreshicon.png! on the page.

Doing this, would result in a NullPointerException, which fills the entire page.

After this, this page shows everytime the Tempo - Project option is choosen.

Stacktrace: https://paste.atlassian.com/view/5673

Video capture: http://screencast.com/t/i1GErHaKC
fields.summary: Tempo's '/secure/TempoProjectBoard!timesheet.jspa' breaks with NullPointerException on the page.
Tempo's shortcut - 't' requires two key board presses to launch Tempo from Dashboard/Project page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26752].
  {panel}

Login as a JIRA user.
Create a Dashboard
Add a JIRA Time Since chart - "Time Since Chart Plugin"
Filter settings are as in !datefield.png!

The chart shows that there are no such issues.

Click on the link 'Total Issues: 0' on the chart.
It takes to the Issue Navigator page, with a JQL.

JQL references the custom field for '[CHART] Date of First Response' as 'customfield_10101' !customfield_referenced_wrongway.png!

This is a wrong way of referencing a custom field in the JQL. It should be either referenced by field name or as cf\[10101\]

Changing the JQL with corrected custom field name, fetches results properly !change_cf_field.png!
fields.summary: Time Since Chart gadget is broken for custom date/datetime fields
Focus problems on create issue dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26735].
  {panel}

On JIRA OnDemand instance.
Use Tempo plugin to Plan Time.

User field double escapes the special chars like é.

And thus, when period checkbox is clicked results in an Error alert which says 'error' no other message.

Video capture: http://screencast.com/t/tygF7Y4eom

Logs show NullPointerExceptions - https://paste.atlassian.com/view/5660

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26734].
  {panel}

Login as an Administrator in JIRA OnDemand instance.

Pre-requisite: Some Tempo work logs against an issue must have been made.

1. Look at the Timesheet for an issue (e.g. https://itest.jira-dev.com/secure/TempoIssueBoard!timesheet.jspa?v=1&periodType=BILLING&periodView=PERIOD&period=0112&issue=BULK-117)

2. Try to edit an entry.

There is a Javascript error which says " Line: 201
Error: Unable to get value of the property 'select': object is null or undefined "


Video capture: http://screencast.com/t/fOuOXpvEweS
fields.summary: In Tempo, when an Administrator tries to edit Timesheet entries a JS Error shows up
Tempo's Users and Groups page mentions about 'jira-administrators' and 'jira-developers' in OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26731].
  {panel}

Login into JIRA OnDemand instance.

1. Log work against an issue using Tempo.
2. View issue, in Tempo Panel for any of the log entry perform an action like 'Move log' etc.

These actions do effect the Logged entries and the Time estimate for an issue.
But these actions do not log any time against the issue.

Whenever such an action takes place, Activity Streams gadget shows "Logged ''" for that issue. As seen here  !Logged_empty.png!.
fields.summary: Activity Streams gadget shows "Logged ''" for an action 'Move/Split/Delete worklog' on an entry logged through Tempo

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26730].
  {panel}

Login into JIRA OnDemand instance which has:
1. Time Tracking - activated
2. Tempo plugin enabled.

----------------------------------------

This behaviour is only on IE9

1. View an issue.
2. Press 't' to launch Tempo's 'Log Work' dialog.
3. Enter the values in the specific fields.
4. Move focus to either 'Add' or 'Add and close' and press the 'Enter' key on the keyboard to submit the values.

This results in !jiraserver_error.png!.

Work gets logged perfectly well, IF, we use Mouse to click on 'Add' button.

Closely monitoring the network logs shows that when key press is used to submit the form, network request such as this '/secure//rest/tempo-rest/1.0/worklogs/PRJAMLKV-212' is made. This fetches a 404 response from the server. !network.png!

This issue does not appear on Chrome or Firefox.


Video capture: http://screencast.com/t/u75PRD26v
fields.summary: On IE9, Tempo's Log Work dialog fails when 'Add/Add and Close' button is pressed using the Enter key
Inserting timestamps in due dates in emails instead of "bare date"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26727].
  {panel}

The ability to [mention people in comments for JIRA v5.0|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+5.0+Beta+2+Release+Notes#JIRA50Beta2ReleaseNotes-sharingandmentions] that was completed in JRA-24796 is great. I am sure that the team will use this feature a lot. 

With that said, one thing that many of the users like is not getting a lot of emails from JIRA. Many of those individuals setup saved filters with gadgets or filter out only needed information in the Activity Stream. That way they can view in RSS or look at the dashboard rather then get the emails. 

Would it be possible to:

# Add a filter on the Activity Stream for mentions to someone and/or
# Add a JQL feature that would allow you to search mentions

Since the mentions are already showing up in the Activity Stream I believe an additional feature would be easiest and meet the need.
fields.summary: Ability to view or filter mentions/shares in the Activity Stream for currentUser()
Positionning of Version
configurable quick links ( like assign to me ) to set items like priority, estimated time, assignees, time spent

fields.description:
User A had created a filter and shared it with all. User A had then subscribed to that filter. Subsequently User A deleted the filter, however, he continues to receive subscription emails.

Additional info: User B had subscribed to the filter as well, since it had been shared with all users.
fields.summary: Subscritpion emails continue after filter has been deleted
how to use jira ? in to project
Add JSTACK.EXE to the standalone distribution
Would like to be able to set a relative date in a custom date field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26706].
  {panel}

This issue has to do with the Application Links Link Rendering Plugin. An error appears in html emails when any type of ticket number is referenced in the comment. The conditions for this is...

* having the [App Linkers|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/559566?versionId=559567] plugin installed
* have an application link created to another atlassian product (associated with a project)
* you're sending html emails.

From what I can see of the error, it looks like the link generation errors somewhere.

{code}
Sending mailitem com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem@5e6c43c6[issue=com.atlassian.jira.issue.IssueImpl@5c302b52[id=56054,summary=Deployment of report_sf_voucher_feedback___trigger on script01,key=ARC-12,created=2012-06-13 14:47:42.0,updated=2012-06-14 11:41:59.047,assignee=com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizUser@628a6425,reporter=com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizUser@628a6425],remoteUser=com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizUser@c0426e41,notificationType=Current_Assignee,eventTypeId=3,templateId=3] ERROR ServiceRunner    Mail Queue Service [atlassian.renderer.v2.V2Renderer] Unable to render content due to system error: No local entity with key 'ARC' and type 'class com.atlassian.applinks.application.jira.JiraProjectEntityTypeImpl' exists
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No local entity with key 'ARC' and type 'class com.atlassian.applinks.application.jira.JiraProjectEntityTypeImpl' exists
	at com.atlassian.applinks.core.DefaultEntityLinkService.getStoredEntityLinks(DefaultEntityLinkService.java:376)
	at com.atlassian.applinks.core.DefaultEntityLinkService.getEntityLinksForKey(DefaultEntityLinkService.java:541)
	at com.atlassian.applinks.core.DefaultEntityLinkService.getEntityLinksForKey(DefaultEntityLinkService.java:531)
	at com.atlassian.applinks.core.DefaultEntityLinkService.getEntityLinks(DefaultEntityLinkService.java:556)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1091.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:58)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:62)
{code}

ARC in this case is just the project of the text that the user typed in (ARC-12). The current workaround that I've found is to use plain text emails since it will not even try to generate a link for the email, but this solution is unacceptable for some of our users.

Please see attached screen shot.
fields.summary: Error in html email from Application Linkers plugin
Allow creation/retrieval of attachment properties from REST as in JRA-6810

Thanks,

Vincent
